pageContext.claim: “You have good police [in Minneapolis], but they're not allowed to do their job. No, they're not allowed to do their job. Remember that? They were told to leave the precinct. Leave it. And then they knock the hell out of that precinct, didn't they, huh?”
pageContext.analysis: An exaggeration. The Minneapolis police did make an unprecedented decision to abandon the 3rd Precinct building on the night of May 28 during riots over the killing of George Floyd. The police made a tactical decision to abandon the 3rd Precinct building during the riots, and the governor ordered the National Guard to reclaim the building the next day.
